Tip: You can branch at any point in the conversation history.  Just click any message in the sidebar hierarchy.
Connect to multiple AI models from one interface - OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, local Llama.cpp, and MCP servers all work together.
Use built-in tools to let AI directly modify your code files, search the web, and manage Git repositories without leaving the chat.
Define multiple projects and switch between them to give AI context about your current workspace and file operations.
Import existing conversations from Google AI Studio via Google Drive to continue your work in AiStudio4.
Navigate complex discussions using the branched conversation tree view to explore different conversation paths.
Interject in AI tool loops in real-time when you need to provide additional input or change direction.
Use the command bar and pinnable shortcuts to quickly access frequently used prompts and commands.
Leverage the AI tool-based theming engine to personalize your interface appearance.
Connect to Ollama models through OpenAI API compatibility for local AI inference.
Use integrated audio transcription with Whisper.net to convert speech to text directly in the application.
Associate specific models, tools, and MCP servers with your system and user prompts for consistent AI behavior.
Set up your first project by going to Project > Manage Projects to provide context for all AI file operations and development tools.
Configure charging strategies for different AI providers to accurately track costs - Claude, OpenAI, and Gemini each have different caching models.
Access the Command Bar with Ctrl+K and type 'Providers' to quickly configure AI service providers and API keys.
Enable tiered pricing for models like Gemini 1.5 Pro that have different rates above and below token boundaries to track costs accurately.
Use local Llama.cpp models by configuring the ModelPath, ContextSize, and GpuLayerCount in the Additional Parameters JSON field.
AiStudio4 automatically downloads the appropriate llama-server binary to your %APPDATA%\AiStudio4\llama-cpp directory when first using Llama.cpp models.
Click the Primary Model and Secondary Model buttons in the Input Bar to quickly switch between models for different tasks.
The active project determines context for all AI tasks, file operations, Git integration, and .NET project analysis - make sure to set it correctly.
Add multiple projects and switch between them using the Project Management dialog to work on different codebases or filesets seamlessly.
Use the folder icon in the menu bar for quick Explorer access to your active project's directory.
Configure reasoning effort levels (low, medium, high) for compatible AI models to balance response quality with processing time.
Toggle the sidebar with Ctrl+B or Cmd+B to quickly access conversation history and the current conversation tree view.
Use the Search Bar in the sidebar to quickly find specific conversations from your chat history.
Set your Active Project Path to provide critical context for AI tasks, file operations, and Git integration - all tools operate relative to this path.
Switch projects automatically by selecting a System Prompt that is associated with a specific project path.
Activate specific tools for each conversation - the AI will only use tools you've enabled.
Connect to external MCP servers to extend your AI's capabilities with additional tools beyond the built-in ones.
View your conversation's branched structure using the interactive Tree View to understand different conversation paths.
Find your conversation files in the %APPDATA%/AiStudio4/convs directory - they're stored as JSON files with unique message IDs.
Associate System Prompts with specific models, tools, user prompts, and projects to create consistent AI behaviors for different workflows.
Use User Prompts as reusable templates and access them via Slash Commands like /my-template or /MyProjectFile.cs.
